intro: Lipochaeta porophila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Lipochaeta porophila is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
